metadata.synopsis: Party defeats Gortash and after the soul consumption scene when she goes to camp. Also addreses if Karlach was at the camp at the moment.
metadata.how_to_trigger: With companion Karlach kill Gortash and go through her dialog with Gortash corpse. Then when she leaves speak with her again at the camp. For camp behaviour recruit Karlach and send to camp, then kill Gortash, speak back to her and select "$Karlach, about Gortash. I killed him."

45.speaker: Karlach
45.context: NodeContext: This scene is after her big dark night of the soul monologue after killing Gortash. She leaves to go to camp and be alone for a bit. When the player returns to camp, she's here, having a moment to herself. She's still raw, but is glad to see the player. If I had my way I'd have her seated for this, but we can't do it budget-wise. Maybe another way to get that sadness/ vulnerability across, like crossed arms, hand to chin, that kind of thing? I'll leave it with ye!

55.speaker: Player
55.text: Still 'soldier' after everything we've been through, huh?
55.context: NodeContext: Being self-deprecating, but she doesn't actually feel she was sulking. She's very grounded here, hence her humour shining through.

83.speaker: Karlach
83.text: Old habits. Did I miss anything while I was off having a sulk?
83.context: NodeContext: Being self-deprecating, but she doesn't actually feel she was sulking. She's very grounded here, hence her humour shining through.

103.speaker: Player
103.text: Not really. But I missed you.
103.context: NodeContext: With a sigh at the top. Put-upon by her love for the player and her imminent death.

23.speaker: Karlach
23.text: I missed you too. You know, I wouldn't have bothered falling in love with you if I'd known saying goodbye would be so hard.
23.context: NodeContext: With a sigh at the top. Put-upon by her love for the player and her imminent death.

97.speaker: Karlach
97.text: I'm trying to stay here, now, alive, while I can. But it's like my mind is whittled down to the black hole that should've been our future.

14.speaker: Karlach
14.text: Ugh, I'm sorry. I don't want you to be sad. I mean, I do. But not too sad.

10.speaker: Player
10.text: I'll be the right amount of sad. Some, but not too much. Just for you.
10.context: NodeContext: a smile behind the line. Feigning seriousness.

36.speaker: Karlach
36.text: I know I can count on you.
36.context: NodeContext: a smile behind the line. Feigning seriousness.

66.speaker: Player
66.text: I'll think of you whenever I burn my hand on a hot stove.
66.context: NodeContext: Player made her laugh through her sadness

7.speaker: Karlach
7.text: Haha! In every blister, there I'll be.
7.context: NodeContext: Player made her laugh through her sadness

69.speaker: Karlach
69.text: Ah, honey. I hope you miss me, but not too much. You have a gift in front of you: A whole life. You have to savour it. Promise?

34.speaker: Karlach
34.text: Good. I know I can trust you to keep your word on that.

25.speaker: Player
25.text: We still have a future. Maybe a shorter one than most, but that doesn't make it less beautiful.

50.speaker: Karlach
50.text: Wow. Gods - you're so right. And we are beautiful, aren't we. This is - it's everything.

64.speaker: Player
64.text: You wouldn't have had a choice. I would've pursued you to the ends of Faerûn.

28.speaker: Karlach
28.text: I probably would've exploded somewhere around Scornubel, so at least your trip home would be short.

111.speaker: Player
111.text: I know what you mean. I'm scared of you leaving me behind.
111.context: NodeContext: Player said they're scared of being left behind by Karlach after she dies. This breaks her heart. She might even well up or cry here.

67.speaker: Karlach
67.text: I don't want to leave you behind. Not ever.
67.context: NodeContext: Player said they're scared of being left behind by Karlach after she dies. This breaks her heart. She might even well up or cry here.

63.speaker: Karlach
63.text: If I had my choice, we'd do it all together. Life - a long life. And then we'd slip away one night, side by side, wrinkled and grey, warm in our bed.
63.context: NodeContext: Recovering herself from previous node ('I don't want to leave you behind'.). Back to business by the end of it.

12.speaker: Karlach
12.text: But that's not in the stars for us, my love. Ours is a short story with a few good twists - and a banger of an ending.
12.context: NodeContext: A bit of gallows humor here. Droll, maybe even deadpan, a touch of bitterness.

0.speaker: Player
0.text: Perhaps that's more our style anyway.

26.speaker: Karlach
26.text: You know, I think you might be right.

17.speaker: Karlach
17.text: Speaking of which. There's something I wanted to ask you.
17.context: NodeContext: Vulnerable, asking the player to be by her side when it's time for her to die.

68.speaker: Karlach
68.text: Will you stay with me? When it's time. For me to go.
68.context: NodeContext: Vulnerable, asking the player to be by her side when it's time for her to die.

104.speaker: Karlach
104.text: I think I can do anything if you're there. Even die.

73.speaker: Player
73.text: Of course I'll be there, Karlach. Whatever you want.
73.context: NodeContext: Sincere, heartfelt, a little verklempt. The player has just agreed to be with her when she dies, no matter what. She's about to change the subject and go back to being merry.

20.speaker: Player
20.text: Of course, my love. Of course.
20.context: NodeContext: Sincere, heartfelt, a little verklempt. The player has just agreed to be with her when she dies, no matter what. She's about to change the subject and go back to being merry.

99.speaker: Karlach
99.context: NodeContext: Sincere, heartfelt, a little verklempt. The player has just agreed to be with her when she dies, no matter what. She's about to change the subject and go back to being merry.

13.speaker: Karlach
13.text: Now! Enough tragedy. I'm not gone yet. And our schedule is packed with important heroics, isn't it.
13.context: NodeContext: Now! Enough tragedy. I'm not gone yet. And our schedule is packed with important heroics, isn't it.

2.speaker: Karlach
2.text: Plus, if I cry any more, I'm going to run out of tears and start leaking motor oil.

80.speaker: Karlach
80.text: Thanks for everything, darling. I love you. A lot.

22.speaker: Karlach
22.text: Thanks for everything, soldier. I'm extremely glad to be in this thing together.

32.speaker: Player
32.text: I'm not sure I can. It'll be too hard.
32.context: NodeContext: Being a little humorous but with an edge. She really does hope she can count on the player.

77.speaker: Karlach
77.text: If I can do it, you can do it. We're in this thing together, you know. If you wanted an easy time of it, you should've given my head to those 'paladins' of Tyr way back when.

101.speaker: Karlach
101.text: As it is, you're stuck loving an in-progress tragedy with a time bomb for a heart. Decisions, decisions.

96.speaker: Karlach
96.text: Hopefully this little misstep has taught you a thing or two about decision-making.

40.speaker: Karlach
40.text: Now. Let's get a move on before I start crying again. At the rate I'm going, all that'll come out is motor oil.

42.speaker: Player
42.text: We're going to cure you before it comes to that. I just know it.
42.context: NodeContext: Being a little humorous but with an edge. She really does hope she can count on the player.

47.speaker: Karlach
47.text: All right. But if we don't, I hope I can count on you. You haven't let me down yet, and it'd be a poor showing to start now.
47.context: NodeContext: Being a little humorous but with an edge. She really does hope she can count on the player.

79.speaker: Player
79.text: I haven't given up, Karlach. We still might be able to fix your engine.
79.context: NodeContext: Telling the player she's ready to accept that she's going to die.

100.speaker: Karlach
100.text: Maybe. But I think... I think the gods are trying to show me my fate. And I think I'm ready to look at it.
100.context: NodeContext: Telling the player she's ready to accept that she's going to die.

107.speaker: Player
107.text: Karlach, would you ever consider going back to Avernus? Just for a while, just to buy yourself more time.

15.speaker: Karlach
15.text: No. I can't. I'd rather die here in Faerûn, my home, than live in service to a devil.

4.speaker: Player
4.text: I understand. I just wish there were another way.

48.speaker: Karlach
48.text: So do I. I've done the calculus a hundred times. There's no permutation I can find that doesn't end in me dead or wishing for death.

65.speaker: Karlach
65.text: This is it. This is all we have. Each other, and all the moments we have left.

106.speaker: Karlach
106.text: This is it. This is all I have. This life, and all the moments I have left here.

35.speaker: Player
35.text: It wouldn't have to be forever. Just long enough for us to figure out a way to fix your engine.

92.speaker: Karlach
92.text: I've considered it. Believe me, I have. But it would take Zariel all of a minute to suss me out and force me back into the Blood War.

62.speaker: Karlach
62.text: I can't do it anymore. I'd wish for death every day. Let me go out surrounded by things I love - not things I hate.

9.speaker: Player
9.text: What about what I want? You're asking me to let you die when we could still prevent it.

43.speaker: Karlach
43.text: I wish I could do what you're asking. I do. But there are things worse than death. Living in the Hells is one of them. I've done it long enough to know.

105.speaker: Player
105.text: Villains rose, heroes fell, and the apocalypse drew nearer.
105.context: NodeContext: Making a joke. Hero said all she's missed is 'villains rising, heroes falling, and the apocalypse drawing nearer'.

16.speaker: Karlach
16.text: Nothing out of the ordinary then.
16.context: NodeContext: Making a joke. Hero said all she's missed is 'villains rising, heroes falling, and the apocalypse drawing nearer'.

84.speaker: Player
84.text: We can talk about that later. I'm more concerned about you.
84.context: NodeContext: Bit of humour, but also serious. The joke is in the all-encompassing-ness of it all.

38.speaker: Karlach
38.text: Would you believe it if I said I'm all right?

39.speaker: Player
39.context: NodeContext: Bit of humour, but also serious. The joke is in the all-encompassing-ness of it all.

6.speaker: Karlach
6.text: That's a change. Seems like world-shattering revelations are coming at us from every angle these days.
6.context: NodeContext: Bit of humour, but also serious. The joke is in the all-encompassing-ness of it all.

19.speaker: Karlach
19.text: You know, soldier, we're so fucked. The Dark Three are trying to consume the Sword Coast, we've still got tadpoles in our eyes, and I've got a ticking time bomb in my chest.
19.context: NodeContext: Bit of humour, but also serious. The joke is in the all-encompassing-ness of it all.

44.speaker: Karlach
44.text: I'm not sure anyone has ever been more fucked than this.

57.speaker: Karlach
57.text: And yet... we're fine. In this moment, we're fine. Here I am. There you are. Breathing. Talking. Even laughing, if we want.

11.speaker: Karlach
11.text: Is it very precious to say that, despite it all, I'm... happy?
11.context: NodeContext: In reaction to the player calling her 'precious'

86.speaker: Player
86.text: I can't be happy when the woman I love is in danger.
86.context: NodeContext: In reaction to the player calling her 'precious'

8.speaker: Karlach
8.text: Ah, my love. We've been in danger since before we even met.

54.speaker: Karlach
54.text: I think we're just those kind of people. Exciteable, weapon-wielding fuckers with a flair for drama.

108.speaker: Player
108.text: It's a nice idea, but I'm not there yet.
108.context: NodeContext: In reaction to the player calling her 'precious'

98.speaker: Karlach
98.text: Very fair. Maybe after we've sorted one or two of the life-ending calamities staring us down.

59.speaker: Karlach
59.text: Speaking of which... there's something I wanted to ask you.

49.speaker: Player
49.context: NodeContext: In reaction to the player calling her 'precious'

52.speaker: Karlach
52.text: In that case, there's something I wanted to ask you.

82.speaker: Player
82.context: NodeContext: In reaction to the player calling her 'precious'

81.speaker: Karlach
81.text: Gods, I've changed. I used to hamstring pit fiends for fun. Look at me now.
81.context: NodeContext: In reaction to the player calling her 'precious'

53.speaker: Karlach
53.text: To make matters, worse, there's something I wanted to ask you.

102.speaker: Player
102.text: This is all well and good, but I can't pretend there isn't a solution here. You could go back to Avernus and live.

90.speaker: Player
90.text: I've been worried about you. Are you all right?
90.context: NodeContext: Bit of a joke., Player asked her if she's ok, and she is, but still.

94.speaker: Karlach
94.text: Yeah, despite my best efforts. I kept trying to flop over and give up, but Karlach just won't let me.
94.context: NodeContext: Bit of a joke., Player asked her if she's ok, and she is, but still.

91.speaker: Player
91.context: NodeContext: Player's fobbed her off a bit, so she's keeping it casual here.

30.speaker: Karlach
30.text: You hope correctly. Had a bit of a cry and a talking-to with the gods, but I think we're square now.
30.context: NodeContext: Player's fobbed her off a bit, so she's keeping it casual here.

56.speaker: Karlach
56.text: Tell me you didn't take on Gortash. Not without me. You wouldn't have.
56.context: NodeContext: responding to the player saying they killed Gortash without her. She can't believe what she's hearing

78.speaker: Player
78.text: It happened faster than I realised. I had no choice.

88.speaker: Karlach
88.text: I can't believe this. You knew what this meant to me. Or you should have, anyway.

21.speaker: Karlach
21.text: At least take me to see the body. I have to see it. I have to look at him one more time.

70.speaker: Karlach
70.text: It's the least you could do.

3.speaker: Player
3.text: A win is a win. Gortash's Netherstone is ours.

93.speaker: Player
93.text: I'm sorry, Karlach. I know you wanted to face him yourself.

75.speaker: Karlach
75.text: No chance of that now, is there? Great. Fantastic.
